intro: Chrysocephalum flavispinum, commonly known as the yellow spinifex, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow to golden-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. It has a low, spreading habit with wiry stems and small, linear leaves. The flowers are clustered in dense heads and are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
